tldr: December quarter revenue reached $124.3B (+4%) and EPS hit a record $2.40 as services and Mac/iPad growth offset flat iPhone. Management guided March-quarter revenue to low-to-mid single-digit growth with FX headwinds and gross margin of 46.5% to 47.5%.
bullets: Revenue was $124.3B (+4% YoY) with EPS of $2.40 (+10% YoY) and all-time records across multiple regions.
iPhone revenue was $69.1B (flat YoY), Mac $9.0B (+16%), iPad $8.1B (+15%), services $26.3B (+14%).
March quarter outlook: revenue low-to-mid single digits, services low double digits, gross margin 46.5%-47.5% and opex $15.1B-$15.3B.
themes: Pricing and cost pressure shaping margins

segments.title: iPhone
points: Revenue was $69.1B, roughly flat YoY with strong performance in multiple markets.
iPhone installed base and upgraders reached all-time highs.

segments.title: Mac and iPad
points: Mac revenue grew 16% to $9.0B on M4 lineup strength.
iPad revenue grew 15% to $8.1B with strong new product demand.

segments.title: Services
points: Revenue hit a record $26.3B, up 14% YoY with double-digit paid account growth.
Services gross margin expanded to 75% on favorable mix.

notes.title: Capital return
points: Returned over $30B to shareholders, including $23.3B in buybacks.

themes.title: China dynamics
points: Greater China revenue declined 11% with channel inventory changes a key driver.
Apple Intelligence availability correlated with better iPhone performance in markets where launched.

themes.title: Gross margin outlook
points: FX headwinds expected in March quarter; mix and services offset at the company level.
Product gross margin benefited from mix and favorable commodity costs.

top_questions.question: How is Apple Intelligence impacting iPhone demand?
top_questions.summary: Markets with Apple Intelligence rollout showed stronger iPhone 16 performance versus markets without it.

top_questions.question: What drove the China revenue decline?
top_questions.summary: Channel inventory reduction and lack of Apple Intelligence in China were key factors.

top_questions.question: Why is March gross margin flattish sequentially?
top_questions.summary: FX headwinds and seasonal leverage are offset by favorable mix and services.

implications: Apple Intelligence rollout is a measurable demand catalyst for iPhone upgrades.
Services margin strength provides buffer against product mix swings.
competitive_notes: China remains highly competitive with subsidy programs and local rivals.
forecast_hooks: Track April language expansion of Apple Intelligence and iPhone momentum.
Monitor China subsidy impact and channel inventory movement.

action_items: Validate iPhone upgrade momentum in markets with Apple Intelligence.
Watch FX effects on March quarter revenue and margins.
open_questions: Timing for Apple Intelligence rollout in China.
Sustainability of services growth versus regional regulatory headwinds.
watch_next_quarter: March quarter iPhone growth versus channel inventory changes.
Services growth rate relative to FX headwinds.
